title: hidden_unicode_codepoints.rs interacts oddly with Firefox Inspector

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The structure of the very special [hidden_unicode_codepoints.rs](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/compiler/rustc_lint/src/hidden_unicode_codepoints.rs) code has a documentation block that includes a left-to-right reversal character.

Its useful that it does this, because it demonstrates the problem that the associated lint is talking about.

However, from what I can tell, its presence in the file is causing the Firefox Inspector to present the remainder of the file in a funny way. See attached image.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/173127/139708706-c09ed947-1791-4d4b-bfc9-cab7b373b4a2.png)

This is truly a minor hiccup, since we expect to see these text flow characters to occur only in *very* rare circumstances in our source code. Still, it would be nice if we could figure out a way to structure that source file that did not cause the Web Browser's inspector functionality to act so oddly.
